definition: to break or cut in two/to sever/to cut off/(fig.) to cut off (a conversation, a flow etc)/to interrupt/(math.) to truncate
to cut off (a length)/to stop/to intercept/section/chunk/length
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: Cannot specify tables to truncate for this template.
sentences.chinese: 不能为该模板指定要截断的表。

sentences.english: The dam backs up the water to prevent flood.
Multiple decimal separators result in truncation.
sentences.chinese: 多个小数分隔符会导致截断。

sentences.english: Under a lightless lorry, cutting his head off.
sentences.chinese: 在没打灯的卡车下，截断了头颅。

sentences.english: Both of Oscar's hind legs were accidentally chopped off in a combine harvester.
sentences.chinese: 奥斯卡的两只后腿不小心被一台联合收割机截断。

sentences.english: His arm was lopped off at the elbow.
sentences.chinese: 他的胳膊齐肘部给截断了。

sentences.english: So the valleys that cut through the mountains are extremely fertile.
sentences.chinese: 那些截断山丘的谷地都是非常肥沃的。

sentences.english: In the northwest, the dunes are interrupted by cityscape.
sentences.chinese: 在西北方向，沙丘则被城市所截断。

sentences.english: Different precisions will be got while using the operators in these methods in different truncate order.
sentences.chinese: 当截断使用这些方法时会得到不同的精度。

sentences.english: False edges due to truncation artifacts can be removed using this method.
sentences.chinese: 本方法可以有效地剔除由截断伪影而引入的虚假边缘。

sentences.english: Dynamic response curves of reduced-order model accord better with original system.
sentences.chinese: 其模态截断后动力响应曲线与原系统吻合较好。

sentences.english: The compiler truncates the extra bits.
Import boxes are a special form of cut-off valve.
sentences.chinese: 进口隔膜阀是一种特殊形式的截断阀。

sentences.english: Verify whether the buffer that has been read is intact and whether it has any truncations or errors.
sentences.chinese: 验证被读取的缓冲区是否完整，是否有截断或者错误。

sentences.english: The dam cuts the river in the middle.
So they put in nerve-racking 16-hour days and work seven-day weeks.
sentences.chinese: 所以他们将在七天，伤脑筋的截断工作几个星期。

definition: to cut off/to chop sth in half
to block (a road)/to plug (a hole)/to stop up
to stop/to obstruct/to bar the way
a way out/a way to retreat/leeway
escape route/retreat route/communication lines to the rear/alternative course of action/room for maneuver
one divides into two/to be two-sided/there are two sides to everything/to see both sb's good points and shortcomings (idiom)
to draw to oneself/to gather up/to collect/to fold up (an umbrella, wings etc)/to assemble (a party of persons)/to rope in (some people)
